item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Fluoxetine promotes metabolic defenses to protect from sepsis-induced lethality (63 points | 23 comments)
2. 0+0 > 0: C++ thread-local storage performance (57 points | 16 comments)
3. Umami is a simple, fast, privacy-focused alternative to Google Analytics (182 points | 99 comments)
4. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (449 points | 42 comments)
5. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (942 points | 320 comments)
6. You're not a senior engineer until you've worked on a legacy project (23 points | 18 comments)
7. Uchū – Color palette for internet lovers (556 points | 226 comments)
8. Reflections on AGI from 1879 (49 points | 5 comments)
9. The secret ingredients of word2vec (2016) (145 points | 12 comments)
10. How do modern compilers choose which variables to put in registers? (245 points | 37 comments)
11. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (206 points | 313 comments)
12. My Time at MIT (115 points | 25 comments)
13. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (266 points | 354 comments)
14. When Not to Obey Orders (2019) (177 points | 76 comments)

23. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (81 points | 83 comments)

25. OpenVINO AI effects for Audacity (143 points | 25 comments)
26. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (336 points | 225 comments)
27. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (140 points | 83 comments)

29. Publish Your Gaussian Splats with SuperSplat (50 points | 9 comments)
